metadata.title: CVE-2022-25313 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.5, an attacker can trigger stackexhaustion in build_model via a large nesting depth in the DTD element.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4+esm6
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4+esm6
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4+esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-4ubuntu1.4+esm6').
cmake: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
